text:
Our clients are essentially
non-profit organizations,
but we do have other organizations
that aren't nonprofit.
Our job really is to

get them access to the
kind of grants that they

want to have access to, the
money that they need
to keep their organizations going.
Bonterra's ambition is to move from

where we are now, at roughly
about 2.5% of US GDP,
going to charitable causes for social good
and we want to get to 3% by 2033.

We did a financial model
over a five year period

and over that five year
period it was very clear

that Amazon was a considerably
more sound investment
than Azure to the tune of about 60%.

We ingested all that data
into an Amazon Q model.
It was essentially a RAG model,
which just gets the data and
brings it back in, augments it with some

artificial intelligence, and
then generates an output.

Anyone from support, from
sales,
from marketing, from some

of the tech parts of our
group can go into there

and find out anything
about any of the companies
that work with us.
The result of it is an increase in SLAs,

service level agreements,
better, quicker answers

to questions that customers
dialing into a support
organization can expect.
And a quicker way that new sales

representatives can understand
the breadth of offerings
that we have to offer our clients.

AWS just had the breadth of
solutions we were looking for
with technical perspective.
They also had the breadth of
vision that they shared with us
to improve social giving,

along the same lines as well,
we are seeking to achieve
